Tariff.Name: Single Trip
Tariff.Description: Rate 1 = for travel in a zone. Rate 2 = for journeys that extend over 2 zones. Rate 3 = for journeys that extend over 3 zones. Rate 4 = for journeys that extend over 4 zones or more.

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Single zone use must be done in 60 minutes
Two zone use must be done in 90 minutes
Three zone use must be done in 120 minutes
Four zone use must be done in 150 minutes

GroupTicket.Name: Primary School Group Ticket
GroupTicket.Description: children and staff in primary schools who travel together during school hours can do so at a greatly reduced price. Primary schools can in the period from kl. 09:00 to 13:30 on weekdays travel with the local buses and only pay NOK. 7, - per person.

GroupTicket.Name: Group Ticket
GroupTicket.Description: It must be possible to buy a single ticket for several people in different categories on the same ticket. If 3 tickets or more are purchased in total, it must automatically give a price for a group ticket on a bus. When a minimum of 3 people travel together, a 33% discount is given on an adult single ticket. Children and seniors tickets are not discounted, but these count in the group. The category Children under 0-5 years must also be included in the group. (Children under 0-5 years are free). Group tickets must be paid in full and only one ticket is issued.

CompanionProfile.Name: Seniors count towards total, but are not discounted
Children count towards total, but are not discounted
Infants count towards total, but are not free anyway

UsageValidityPeriod.Name: User may choose moment of activation
Ticket must be used within six months [??CHeck??] of purchase

FareStructureElement.Name: What happens if user status changes

EligibilityChangePolicy.Name: If user has already purchased a single ticket and elibility changes eg (i) becoming eligible, adult to senior; or student, (ii) Losing eligibility, e.g. child to adult.
EligibilityChangePolicy.Description: If user becomes eligible for discount, do nothing - ticket is still valid. If user ceases to be eligible, ticket is no longer valid

CappingRule.Name: Level 1: Max usage within 24 hour
CappingRule.Description: Capping of use within 24 hours, set at cost of 24 hour pass

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Rules on capping
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: How much has the customer shopped for the last 24 hours (Adult Category) - Level 1 A. If the total price is above the price for 24 hours, the trip is free, B. If the price is below the price for 24 hours but gives higher price 24 hours after current purchases, price is reduced to reduced price to price for 24 hours. A purchase for category X is registered at a price paid to achieve this level. C. If the price is below the price for 24 hours and does not give a higher price than 24 hours after current purchases, the full price is paid.

UsageValidityPeriod.Name: Sliding window allowed for start of capping period

CappingRule.Name: Level 2: Maximum usage within 7 days
CappingRule.Description: Capping of use within 7 days; set at cost of 7 day pass. How much has the customer shopped for the last 7 days A. If the total price is above the price for season tickets 7 days, the trip is free B. If the price is below the price for 7 days, but gives a higher price than season tickets 7 days after current purchases, the priceshortened to price period isto 7 days. A purchase for category X is registered at a price paid to achieve this level. C. If the price is below the price for 7 days and does not give a higher price than the season ticket 7 days after the current purchase, the is accordingly and go to the next step. (Assess Level 1)

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Rules on capping
GenericParameterAssignment.Description: Who qualifies to cap is specifed by a validable elements. We define one for each user type, each with a specifc LIMITING RULE defined for it.

UsageValidityPeriod.Name: Sliding window allowed for measuring start of capping period

GenericParameterAssignment.Name: Adult caps to adult product thresholds
Youth usage also caps to adult product thresholds
Young adult usage also caps to adult product thresholds
Senior usage also caps to adult product thresholds

CappingRule.Name: Level 3: Maximum usage within 30 days
CappingRule.Description: Capping of use within 30 days; set at cost of 30 day pass How much has the customer shopped for the last 30 days (Applies to all categories ) - Level 3 A. If the total price exceeds the price for season tickets 30 days, the trip is free. B. If the price is below the price for 30 days , but gives a higher price than period cards 30 days after current purchases, price is reduced to a price equal to a period of 30 days. A purchase for category X is registered at a price paid to achieve this level. C. If the price is below the price for 30 days and does not give a higher price than a season ticket 30 days after the current purchase, the price is reduced accordingly and go to the next step. (Assess Level 2)

UsageValidityPeriod.Name: Sliding window allowed for measuring start of capping period

CappingRule.Name: Level 4: Maximum usage within 180 days
CappingRule.Description: Capping of use within 180 days; set at cost of 180 day pass. How much has the customer shopped for the last 180 days (Applies to all categories) - Level 4 A. If the total price above the price for season tickets is 180 days, the trip is free. B. If the price is below the price for 180 days, but gives a higher price than a period card 180 days after the current purchase, the price is reduced to a price equal to the period 180 days. A purchase for category X is registered at a price paid to achieve this level. C. If the price is below the price for 180 days and does not give a higher price than a period card 180 days after the current purchase

Tariff.Name: Vy on-the-fly rebate
Tariff.Description: The PTO has defined a set of rules that reduces the price of a fare product based on the number of previous purchases within a (specified) 30 day period when all ticket purchases have the same geographical parameters, level of service (in practice: same fare class) and user profile:

QualityStructureFactor.Name: first 4 single ticket purchases at full rate
next purchases (tickets number 5-10) at a discount e.g. 30 %
next purchases (tickets number 11-20) at a discount e.g. 60%
further purchases within the 30 day period at no cost

FareStructureElement.Name: Which products are eligble for discount (NBCould get fancier and have different steps for different products)

RuleStepResult.Narrative: Previous single journey below 24 hour capping limit
Previous single journey below 24 hour capping limit
Cap reached: charge is difference between previous travel and 24 hour pass value trip@35.00 + trip@35.00 + (trip@29.00 - diff@15) = 24h@84 (capping limit) .

Blacklist.Name: Superceded tickets
Blacklist.Description: Tickets that are now invalid because capping has led to an upgraded replacement being issued. In most cases previous purchase will have already expired, but in certain circumstances it may still potentially be valid. Can use blacklist to disqualify
